question.title: Counting number of sentences and words in text
question.content:
Given a text, text. The task is to count the number of sentences and words in the text. 
Definition of a sentence :- Sentences are defined as contiguous space-separated strings of characters ending with a sentence punctuation (' . ',  ' ! ' or ' ? ') or the last contiguous set of space-separated strings, even if they don't end with a punctuation mark.
Definition of a word :- Words are defined as a string of alphabetic characters i.e. any upper or lower case characters a-z or A-Z.

Example 1:

Input: text = "Sentences"
Output: 1 1
Explaination: There is only one word and 
sentence in the given text.

Example 2:

Input: text = "many??? Sentences are"
Output: 2 3
Explaination: There are two sentences and 
three words.

Your Task:
You do not need to read input or print anything. Your task is to complete the function sentenceWord() which takes text as input parameters and returns a list containing number of sentences and words respectively.

Expected Time Complexity: O(|text|)
Expected Auxiliary Space: O(1)

Constraints:
1 ≤ |text| ≤ 250

rephrased.body:
Given a text string, count the number of sentences and words present. 

**Definition of a sentence:** Sentences are sequences of space-separated characters ending with a sentence punctuation mark ('.', '!', '?') or the last sequence of space-separated characters in the text, even if it doesn't end with a punctuation mark.

**Definition of a word:** Words are strings consisting of only alphabetic characters (a-z, A-Z).

testcases.explanation: The input contains one sentence and one word.

The input contains two sentences and three words. 'many???' counts as one sentence because it's followed by punctuation, and 'Sentences are' is the final sentence. The words are 'many', 'Sentences', and 'are'.

hints:
A sentence ends if there is any of these three symbols ' . ', ' ? ' and ' ! ' present after any word.
A word ends if there is space or any sentence ending symbol after any character.
